info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 12 at 1:10AM CDT until March 12 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM CST FOR CHICOT AND ASHLEY COUNTIES... At 1210 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mcmillan Corner to near Snyder to 8 miles southeast of Ingalls, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Lake Village, Mcmillan Corner and Snyder around 1215 AM CST. West Crossett around 1220 AM CST. Portland and Montrose around 1225 AM CST. Crossett, North Crossett and Old Milo around 1230 AM CST. Hamburg around 1240 AM CST. Chicot Junction and Berlin around 1250 AM CST. Eudora around 1255 AM CST. Wilmot and Parkdale around 105 AM CST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Halley. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
